entry.title: Hold the postmortem: The metaverse was never alive in the first place
entry.quote: People never really bought into the idea of the metaverse, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t interested in collaborative open worlds.

entry.title: GitHub’s automatic coding tool rests on untested legal ground /
entry.quote: The Copilot tool has been trained on mountains of publicly available code

entry.title: Is Avoiding Extinction from AI Really an Urgent Priority?
entry.quote: We should be wary of Prometheans who want to both profit from bringing the people fire, and be trusted as the firefighters.

entry.title: When photography produces something other than photographs
entry.quote: I was struck by one sentence you said in the Blind Camera video “the code is as much an artwork as the object and the resulting images”:

entry.title: Was Modern Art Really a CIA Psy-Op?
entry.quote: In the battle for “hearts and minds,” modern art was particularly effective. John Hay Whitney, both a president of MoMA and a member of the Whitney Family, which founded the Whitney Museum of American Art, explained that art stood out as a line of national defense, because it could “educate, inspire, and strengthen the hearts and wills of free men.”
